answers.answer: Hi!The commonest cause of tachycardia in a 11 year old is anemia—often manifested with start of periods. Worms is another cause of anemia. Tachycardia or high pulse rate can be due to low BP, hyperthyroidism, fever, low blood sugar, anxiety and panic disorder, heart causes like sinus tachycardia and palpitations, alcohol, coffee, effect of certain drugs etc.Please consult your PCP to run tests and examination to clinch a diagnosis. Take care!

question: My 11 yr old daughter came to me c/o chest pain and that her heart hurt.  I took her BP 102/62 with a heart rate of 163. Her temp was normal.  I put a pulseoximeter on her finger to monitor the heart rate and it stayed about 155-166 for a while, I had her lay down and tried to calm her and reasure her she was ok.  I have had palpitations r/t thyroid condition. benign nodules.  However my condition manifested in my 40's.  She is 11.  Besides thyroid issue, what else could it be? Thank you.
title: tachycardia at 11 yrs old, thyroid or diabetes
